New Records: Ohtani set the Dodgers' franchise record for home runs, surpassing Shawn Green's 49 from 2001.
He became the third player in MLB history to have at least six hits, three home runs, and 10 RBIs in a game.
Ohtani reached the 50-50 milestone, becoming the first player in MLB history to do so.
Key Match Events: Ohtani hit three home runs and stole two bases in the same game, a first for the Dodgers and a rare feat in MLB.
The game was a 20-4 rout of the Marlins, securing the Dodgers' playoff spot.
Post-Match Reflections: Players and teammates reflected on Ohtani's performance, expressing pride and amazement.
Manager Dave Roberts highlighted Ohtani's emptying the tank offensively and his impact on the team's playoff chances.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was at LoanDepot Park, where Ohtani had memorable moments before, including a previous World Baseball Classic win.
Ohtani's achievements as a two-way player and his impact on the Dodgers' season are noted, with mentions of his MVP potential and playoff participation.
